commit_scope: Harden provider usage/readiness probes: parse RFC9233 rate-limit headers (e.g. ratelimit-limit: 1000;w=3600), broaden recognized rate-limit header keys for OpenAI/Claude probes, add GitHub billing endpoint fallbacks to reduce 404 noise, and downgrade optional unconfigured providers (e.g. openclaw) from warning to info unless observed in runtime usage.

e2e_validation.expected_behavior_delta: Provider usage/readiness should show fewer false warnings (optional unconfigured providers are info), and more providers should surface request remaining/limit metrics when servers emit RFC9233-style ratelimit headers or provider-specific ratelimit keys; GitHub billing minutes should populate when accessible via configured owner/scope or authenticated user fallback.
test_flows: api:/api/automation/usage -> verify Railway/OpenAI/Claude rate-limit metrics appear when headers are present; ensure no 'no request remaining headers' note when RFC9233 headers are returned
api:/api/automation/usage/readiness -> verify optional unconfigured providers (e.g. openclaw) severity=info unless observed in runtime usage
api:/api/automation/usage -> verify GitHub billing minutes appear when token has billing access (owner/scope or /user fallback)

phase_gate.reason: Awaiting CI and (optional) production endpoint verification for provider probes
